ygData.subject: Re: Ideas for a low level newbie?
ygData.msgSnippet: Bash=stun If you like using a shield then max this skill out as it will interupt magic users A LOT more than kick. Jaade, Indigo Sista Solder.
ygData.messageBody:
Bash=stun

If you like using a shield then max this skill out as it will interupt magic
users A LOT more than kick.

Jaade,
Indigo Sista Solder.

> ----------
> From: Chtuga[SMTP:webmaster@...]
> Reply To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Sent: Friday, May 14, 1999 10:15 PM
> To: warriors_eq@onelist.com
> Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Ideas for a low level newbie?
>
> From: "Chtuga" <webmaster@...>
>
> Hail
>
> I am a lvl 16 Barbarian warrior, and here are my advises:
>
> You should decide already now wether you want use a 2h weapon or a 1h
> weapon. Personally I went for the 1H.
>
> This will make you a bit less effective untill you reach about lvl 15,
> when
> you get dual wield and doubble attack. This will from there on be pretty
> much the same, if not better than a 2h weapon.
> Since you are a Human warrior, you cannot use bash, and 2 1H weapons or a
> 2H
> weapon and bash due to that you will need a shield. Therefor you should
> keep
> on using Kick. Bash never will hit it for you, if you dont decide to use a
> shield and a 1h sword, who I havent seen any warrior over lvl 15 use.
> Also keep Taunt and Sense heading maxed, these are two good skills to use
> in
> the future. A warrior who cannot taunt the beast whacking the wizard to
> pieces are no warrior at all and will loose.
> Bind Wounds is expensive to work up, but I have now learned it is a very
> usefull skill and should be worked on. (have a magician summon bandages
> for
> you)
>
> It is also recommended that you have a primary weapon skill, and a
> secoundary. At later levels if you find an awesome weapon you be sure you
> can use it! I would personally recommend working 1h slash as primary, and
> 2h
> slash as secoundary.
>
> You never need to put more than one skill point in any skill, but some
> skills can be a pain in the ass to work when they are under 10 skill. I
> have
> never put more than 9 in a skill, and I now have almost maxed out Doubble
> attack and dual wield at lvl 16 (soon 17).
>
> A place for you to hunt now at lvl 7 and all the way up to lvl 15 or 16 is
> BlackBurrow.
> I did it up to lvl 16 there.
>
> At last I would like to tell you all about a messageboard for Warriors.
>
> www.interzet.com
> Goto messageboards - warrior.
> It is well visited!
>
> Chtuga
> Barbarian warrior
> E'ci server
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kelly Pruett <pruett@...>
> To: Warrior List <EQ_Warrior@onelist.com>; Warrior2 List
> <warriors_eq@onelist.com>
> Date: 14. mai 1999 14:53
> Subject: [warriors_eq] Ideas for a low level newbie?
>
>
